title: Riot should insta-ban any account that says this in chat:
body:
> EDIT 2:

Due to some very well reasoned responses (Thanks to "not brna xDD" and "PaladinNO") I've come to realize that my initial stance was far too harsh. I have changed my stance to the following:

Players exhibiting the behavior described below should be subject to immediate chat restriction (possibly across all of their existing accounts) and some sort of notification or reform card. This is not too harsh, and it also would clear any doubt they had as to the system's ability to track and punish them.

> Original Post:

"I don't care if you report me, I have # other accounts."

Seriously, this is the most tilting thing to hear from a teammate ever. They take the system and spit it in your face with such contempt. On top of that it usually accompanies a whole host of other toxic behavior which they were already told to stop.

They're clearly being extremely shitty humans; they clearly don't intend to reform, and they clearly don't care about the impact they are having on their fellow teammates. This deserves a zero tolerance policy. Any player who says this should instantly lose their account, and maybe even get put on a watch list for identifying alt accounts to watch more closely for toxic behavior.

> EDIT:

It's clear from people's responses that I didn't clarify well, and I came off sounding very extreme. So here's a better explanation of what I mean here:

 I specifically am talking aout players who are already being unsportsmanlike, toxic, and hurtful to others. When they respond with,

"haha I don't care Riot's punishment system doesn't apply to me and you can't do anything to stop me!"

That is the sort of situation I am talking about.

The player is already being toxic, already exhibiting behavior deemed unacceptable by Riot and the community. It's taking it one step further and holding the system in contempt that I believe is the final kicker. That is what I believe to be a fair reason to permaban.

It's not just the act of saying that that I believe should be the reason to permaban. It is the act of saying that in addition to already being toxic.

Yes but, you can't start a fire without some source of ignition and fuel. What caused this player to reach this level of hostility? He surely didn't light himself on fire (so to speak) and without something to feed his flame.. he wouldn't continue the behavior. Someone else on his team is instigating and causing him to keep being hostile, it doesn't matter what you say to a player who is in this mode.. you should simply say nothing to them. Once someone is "tilted", "sparked", "on fire", the best method to prevent further issues is to simply pretend anything they said isn't there and don't aim anything at all towards them (not even a "Nice" or "GJ", nothing).

I understand fully your logic that things being said like this are unacceptable and should be punished, but often there's a lot that leads up to something like this being said that cannot be overlooked. Players do not just start off like this and it IS possible for a player to clean himself up and get themselves into a better mindset after being so heavily disturbed.

Many times I've said things I don't mean while playing this game, I've been chat restricted a couple times. Does that make me a bad person? No, not really. In fact I'm probably one of the nicest people you'll ever meet in real life. This game is very competitive, it's hard, it's frustrating to do your best and still struggle against another player who is better than you. It's not easy to control your emotions dealing with the amount of stress League induces when you are really trying your hardest and still losing. People say things they don't mean, their behavior gets out of check.

None of it means they deserve a permanent ban the instant they believe they're above the system. Once someone gets chat restricted or temporary banned they'll soon realize that they are not any better than anyone else and that they have things they can lose as well. That's the entire point of having the system, is to make players realize that they need to adjust their behavior because they're out of line.

You wouldn't call the police on your child simply because he told you that he hates you and hopes you die, the League system is set up to be no different. The system isn't going to permanently  ban someone just because they're agitated, ignorant, and begin saying things which they really don't mean. Not everyone will learn and adjust, but a lot of players likely will and it wouldn't be fair for those players to get permanently banned the first time they slip up and say something stupid like this.
